intro: Aria astateria, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its star-shaped, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Aria astateria is often found in woodland areas and along streambanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
